citation.title: Design, synthesis, and X-ray crystal structure of classical and nonclassical 2-amino-4-oxo-5-substituted-6-ethylthieno[2,3-d]pyrimidines as dual thymidylate synthase and dihydrofolate reductase inhibitors and as potential antitumor agents.

citation.name: Am. J. Hum. Genet.
citation.title: Dihydrofolate reductase deficiency due to a homozygous DHFR mutation causes megaloblastic anemia and cerebral folate deficiency leading to severe neurologic disease.

comment.text: Key enzyme in folate metabolism. Contributes to the de novo mitochondrial thymidylate biosynthesis pathway. Catalyzes an essential reaction for de novo glycine and purine synthesis, and for DNA precursor synthesis. Binds its own mRNA and that of DHFR2.
Cofactor biosynthesis; tetrahydrofolate biosynthesis; 5,6,7,8-tetrahydrofolate from 7,8-dihydrofolate: step 1/1.
Widely expressed in fetal and adult tissues, including throughout the fetal and adult brains and whole blood. Expression is higher in the adult brain than in the fetal brain.

disease.name: Megaloblastic anemia due to dihydrofolate reductase deficiency
disease.description: An inborn error of metabolism, characterized by megaloblastic anemia and/or pancytopenia, severe cerebral folate deficiency, and cerebral tetrahydrobiopterin deficiency. Clinical features include variable neurologic symptoms, ranging from severe developmental delay and generalized seizures in infancy, to childhood absence epilepsy with learning difficulties, to lack of symptoms.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the dihydrofolate reductase family.

property.value: Constitutional megaloblastic anemia with severe neurologic disease
Tetrahydrobiopterin (BH4) synthesis, recycling, salvage and regulation
Activation of E2F1 target genes at G1/S
F:translation repressor activity, nucleic acid binding
P:positive regulation of nitric-oxide synthase activity
P:regulation of removal of superoxide radicals
P:regulation of transcription involved in G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle

feature.description: NADP; via amide nitrogen and carbonyl oxygen
Decreases affinity for NADP and dihydrofolate over 10-fold.
Strongly decreased affinity for methotrexate. Decreases catalytic rate constant 200-fold. Decreases affinity for NADP and dihydrofolate over 10-fold.
Reduces catalytic rate 5-fold. Reduces affinity for dihydrofolate 9-fold; when associated with E-36.
Reduces catalytic rate 2-fold. Reduces affinity for dihydrofolate 9-fold; when associated with R-32.
Increases affinity for dihydrofolate about 3-fold. Reduces affinity for NADPH about 3-fold.
Increases affinity for dihydrofolate about 2-fold. No effect on affinity for NADPH.
Increases affinity for dihydrofolate about 3-fold. No effect on affinity for NADPH.
Increases affinity for dihydrofolate about 15-fold. No effect on affinity for NADPH.
